body_html:
Ubuntu 14.04 is supported. That was an update error (adding 16.04 in the list was the actual intent).
…
On Wed, Mar 29, 2017, 8:18 AM Justine Tunney ***@***.***> wrote: Thank you for bringing this to our attention @Anida-qin <https://github.com/Anida-qin>. It seems you did your homework and discovered a closed duplicate #3618 <#3618> although it helps when you bring that to our attention. It seems the Bazel site claims <https://bazel.build/versions/master/docs/install-ubuntu.html> Ubuntu 14.04 is out of their support matrix, which I find peculiar, because that's what Google installed on my workstation. It's not EOL until 2019. It is in the TensorFlow support matrix. (Attn: @damienmg <https://github.com/damienmg>) @Anida-qin <https://github.com/Anida-qin> GCC 4.8 is available <http://packages.ubuntu.com/trusty/allpackages> on Ubuntu 14.04. If you were to apt-get install those, would it help? — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#8709 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ADjHfzkj9HqIIbQdP_JariVpREnf4pL1ks5rqfeZgaJpZM4Mo_el> .

list was the actual intent).

body:
Ubuntu 14.04 is supported. That was an update error (adding 16.04 in the
list was the actual intent).

On Wed, Mar 29, 2017, 8:18 AM Justine Tunney <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Thank you for bringing this to our attention @Anida-qin
> <https://github.com/Anida-qin>. It seems you did your homework and
> discovered a closed duplicate #3618
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/3618> although it helps
> when you bring that to our attention.
>
> It seems the Bazel site claims
> <https://bazel.build/versions/master/docs/install-ubuntu.html> Ubuntu
> 14.04 is out of their support matrix, which I find peculiar, because that's
> what Google installed on my workstation. It's not EOL until 2019. It is in
